The crab meat was also inconsistent - some pieces were nicely cooked and juicy, while others were mushy.
Overall, the ambiance and service were top-notch, and the food had its high points.  However, the inconsistency with the seafood quality brought the rating down a notch.  A minor point, but the water was also quite expensive.  They did accept coupons we found on Instagram, which was a nice perk.  There's also free valet parking, which is a big plus.  I'd recommend this restaurant if you want instagramable shots, but keep in mind the potential for some variability in the seafood freshness.

.

Description:
Came across Laung‚Äôs ad and 50% discount offer in Khaleej Times which tempted us to visit this newly opened restaurant.
Being in Nation Tower this restaurant has lined up the Menu worth attracting the local and Arab patrons. Tastes and spices have also been adjusted accordingly in the predominant Indian dishes.
Though the vegetarian spread is limited but we weren‚Äôt disappointed. Best was the Grilled Watermelon Ricotta Cheese Salad. Ummm‚Ä¶ the salad was bursting with myriad of flavors. Sweet watermelon, salty cheese, sharp n pungent rocket leaves, juicy strawberry, apples, seeds and pomegranates and tangy dressing. Loved it‚Ä¶.
In the main-course we had ordered jackfruit curry (kathal) n daal makhani. Jackfruit preparation was good and distinct jackfruit taste was relishable amidst the not so spicy curry. The coating of jackfruit though was thicker. The coating done while frying should be delicate and thin. Daal Makhani was quite good and upto the Peppermill standard.
We reached the restaurant at 10:30 pm and was completely empty and nearing the closing time. Shameem seated us with full courtesy and waited on us patiently beyond the closing hours. Full marks to him. He had complete knowledge of the dishes featured in the menu and answered all my detailed queries about the ingredients etc to my satisfaction. In many of the restaurants the involvement of serving staff is missing.
Another item which caught my eye was Ghongura Tandoori Paneer but have left it for next time.
And no, they don‚Äôt accept Fazaa discount‚Ä¶ Management is requested to consider Fazaa card. Almost all the outlets in Nation Tower including the Jewelley Shop give discount on Fazaa card. üòä

A place with an ideal location over looking breakwater and Abu Dhabi beach.. it's still under development and it gave me a feeling that it's still in soft opening. We mainly struggled with service, orders were slow and there weren't enough staff based on the size of the restaurant.
We ordered a number of flat breads (mixed cheese, zaatar and mushroom &cheese) very nice dough and ingredients with a nice crust.
Additionally we ordered tabouleh , hummos and falafel. Hummos was good, tabouleh was moderate and the falafel was small, over priced and wasn't well done interns of taste and texture.
Final order was hummos fatte which was really bad and tasteless. It needs to be changed to match the quality of the rest of the items.
They took long time to get the drinks which were basically khameer tea and karak tea. Karak tea had nothing to do with the standard karak tea. It was simply tea and milk without any other flavours. Khameer tea was decent but had a slightly strong cinnamon taste.
They need to work on their service and quality of food to match the location. Even the menu was filled with spelling mistakes just like my review üòÇ.
Some fixes and tweaks and it would be one of the best middle Eastern dining spots in the capital. Would give it another chance next time. Hope to see and improvement in the food menu.

Throughout Italy and Sicily  and entire pizza world , I‚Äôve never eaten raw salami on pizza. So, it‚Äôs just a different experience and don‚Äôt recommend it to other customers.

The wine by the glass is basically low budget and low quality. There are much better budget wines available that can be served but maybe unavailable in UAE. The numerous high quality bottle wines on menu are super expensive.
Overall good experience for special night out at a highly popular location. I may return just for pizza.

Incredible interior design with an exquisite atmosphere. Delicious food with authentic Greek recipes! Went there for dinner with friends. Started off with their dips (the trio). We chose Tzatziki, Melitzanosalata and Beetroot Skordalia. Incredible way to start off the meal! The waiters were generous with bread but we were a big group and when we asked for more break they kind enough to provide a big plate; no questions asked! Next up; starters/ salads: Feta cheese wrapped in Phyllo, Keftedes and Dakos. DIVINE! The presentation, attention to detail and the flavor hit strong! We started feeling full but we got ecstatic for the main course once the waiters brought them over: Moussaka and Souvlaki Platter. We chose these two specifically to test the authenticity of Greek food and boy did they deliver! Moussaka was creamy, cheesy and the filling was on point! The Souvlaki Platter hit the nail. While the rice was zesty and delicious, the skewers were a game changer. I can't recall the last time I've had such tender meat! Super filling! By that time we were convinced that we've had enough but their head waiter, Panos, strongly recommended we don't leave until we've had - at least - one of their unique desserts. He personally recommended the Bougasta. Cannot thank him enough for the recommendation! Would have certainly been disappointed if I left and missed out! The generous vanilla pastry cream worked super well with the phyllo (covered in cinnamon powder) and to top it all off a scoop of - one of a kind - cinnamon ice cream made our night! Was a delightful experience and will definitely be back sooner than later!
Note: they have a variety of unique drinks; I ordered the Blueberry Fizz. Did not disappoint at all!

The birthday girl selected this restaurant to celebrate her birthday as has been our family tradition. We sat down on fri night with great expectations and were not very pleased with the restaurant given that it‚Äôs part of a chain like St. Regis no less.
Firstly the name is deceptive- ‚Äúthe terrace‚Äù happens to be on the ground floor and doesn‚Äôt have any feel of its name - at least during these summer months. The website has pictures of the exterior sitting but due to the heat it must have been off limits.
Call it cozy you may, but the first impression upon entering the restaurant was a cramped dining area with table too close to each other leaving no room to walk between them - rendering everyone to use the buffet aisle resulting in a jam.
Then we were told it‚Äôs an international buffet On Fridays which actually turned out to be a continental buffet far from being an international cuisine. As there were no stations for Indian food or Chinese for that matter. Ironically their website only has pictures of sushi platters and Indian dishes.
It‚Äôs hard to believe an international buffet to not have biryani or tandoori dishes let alone dedicated Indian stations or sushi and sashimi for that matter. Ironically. Which by the way are aplenty in the other five star restaurants like at the fairmont (CuiScene) or the Marriott Alfirsan (Khayal) or the JW Marriott Marquis Hotel Dubai (kitchen 6). We assume St. Regis would be in the same league but boy we were wrong.
To be fair to them the salad was nice and the service was available at an arms length. Loved the salmon with lemon dish and seafood. The Arabic salad was very tasty but the smoked salmons didn‚Äôt the other raw fish were both hardened with exposure to air. There were no prawns in the salads nor any prawns dish by itself save some prawns in one of the main dishes. We asked for rotis or naans and were served ready to cook Lulu parathas of sorts which was a dampener.
The pasta station was good for the kids so that kept them busy and the best part of the buffet was the dessert which was awesome.
Overall we probably chose the wrong day to dine there but the buffet was certainly not worth the price. So unless you are on a diet and want to eat just the salad and the dessert and wiling to dish out AED 195 per pax be my guest.

Restaurants and Bars: The St. Regis Abu Dhabi has several restaurants and bars where you can enjoy a variety of cuisines. A variety of dining options are available, including Mediterranean, Asian, and steakhouse options.
Spa and Recreation: The hotel features exclusive spa facilities for relaxation and pampering. Guests will also enjoy a pool, fitness center, and beach access.
Event Facilities: The St. Regis Abu Dhabi also has extensive facilities for hosting events and conferences, such as business meetings and weddings.
The St. Regis Abu Dhabi is one of the premier Abu Dhabi accommodations, offering luxurious stays and excellent service. This is one of the recommended hotels for those looking for a comfortable stay when visiting the United Arab Emirates. Please consider making a reservation when you visit.
